alert.note: Alert for Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:19PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, west central Whiteside, northeastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 319 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Low Moor, or near Clinton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Camanche, Albany, Princeton and East Clinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
